intro: Heteranthocidium dactylopterum, commonly known as the featherleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into parachute-like seeds. It thrives in moist, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
